span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: latoregular, serif; color: black;

p.span: Welcome to the Medway Public Schools website. In an effort to ensure that you are connected to the latest information and communications associated with our recent school closure (currently scheduled through May 4th), we have created a central site for all of our School Closure Resources and Supports. This new site includes all alternate enhancement student learning plans for students, PK-12. This site can be accessed through this

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: latobold, serif; color: rgb(25, 26, 86);
font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: latoregular, serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: We expect that the transition to virtual educational experiences will bring both successes and challenges. I encourage families to stay in touch with our teachers and school leaders to communicate successes, questions, and concerns. These are uncharted waters and we are all learning as we go; please be patient as we navigate this new reality together.

span.br: For Information Regarding Online Registration, please visit our Student Registration site.

div.p: A collection of Articles, News, and Social Media
The 2019-2024 Strategic Plan represents the foundational values of the Medway Public School System as well as the major work for the district for the next five years.

div.div: Update to share that the Medway School Committee, upon my recommendation, has voted to adjust the 2019-2020 school calendar. Based on feedback from families and staff, we will continue remote learning Tuesday, April 21-Friday, April 24, in lieu of April vacation. Please note that Monday, April 20 remains a no school day as it is a state holiday. Thank you to the many families who participated in our quick survey that resulted in an overwhelming consensus around continuing learning next week. Our last day of school will now be Thursday, June 19, 2020.

a.title: Superintendent's Update dated 4/7/2020 on Remote Learning for Medway Public Schools.
